fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7936].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. There are a number of add-ons on the Atlassian Marketplace available to support this. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

A customer requested cascading fields that have more than 2 levels of variables. They specifically requested the ability to have up to a 3 level - 4 level deep cascading field list. 

Perhaps this could be programmed in such a way that would easily allow customers to add as many levels as they wished?
fields.summary: Add 3+ level cascading custom field type

This was mostly caused by JRA-7566

Add the ability to send event notifications to Component Lead

fields.description:
Test scenario (XML Backup is enclosed):
(1) logon as user oper/ oper
(2) create new issue: project _SOLUTIONS, issue type: Support Request
(3) edit/ comment issue, create attachment ... whatever
(4) select workflow operation: Ready for QA
(5) ERROR: illegal workflow operation (see attachment)

A user of the OPERATIONS department shall only create issues, but shall not be allowed to assign issues 
(which would entail that they can assign sub-tasks, too)! 

Therefore, I designed the workflow in a way that the assignment is made automatically via workflow post function 
(Assign To = qa). After the Operations-User has finished providing input on the problem s/he has (create, edit and
comment issue, create attachments), the issue shall be "handed over to QA" for further processing.

Does the workflow post function I used always require that the user executing the workflow transition has the "Assign Issues permission"??? 
I definitely do NOT want to allow OPERATIONS to assign issues ... can tell you me a way for working around this???

=====================================================================

Problem-relevant items:
User: oper / oper
Project = _SOLUTIONS
Permission scheme = QA-PI
Workflow = SupportRequest
Workflow step = Open
Workflow actions: Ready for QA, Resolve
fields.summary: Unable to execute workflow post function

fields.description: user can only view bugs raised by him/herself
fields.summary: ITS/test/user can only view bugs raised by him/herself

fields.description:
In jira-application.properties we have:

jira.releasenotes.templates = releasenotes-text.vm, releasenotes-html.vm
jira.releasenotes.templatenames = Text, Html

One can add new templates by appending to the lists, but:

jira.releasenotes.templates = releasenotes-text.vm, releasenotes-html.vm, myreleasenotes.vm
jira.releasenotes.templatenames = Text, Html, My release notes

doesn't work, because templatenames breaks on commas and spaces, so JIRA would find 5 template names.  We should split only on commas.
fields.summary: Allow spaces in names of release note templates

fields.description: In professional edition, all issue types are set to the issue type of the first selected issue during a bulk move.

fields.description:
Upon executing custom goal jira:release-professional I receive the following error:

BUILD FAILED
File...... D:\java_src\webapps\jira\atlassian-jira-professional-3.3-source\jira\maven.xml
Element... copy
Line...... 845
Column.... 93
D:\ant- not found.

The lines in the maven.xml are:

<!--Bundle ant with release -->
            <copy preservelastmodified="true" todir="${maven.build.dir}/release/tools/ant/">
                <fileset dir="${ant.location}/ant-${ant.version}"/>
            </copy>

The directory tree "release/tools/ant" are not created.
fields.summary: Source building -> Bundle ant with release fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7922].
  {panel}

It would be great if you could create a new jelly tag for Votes. In my case I import issues from our previous system with jelly scripts and I have a pb since they are no jelly tags for Votes. A new tag will enable me to add the votes relative to the issue when I create it. Of course the tag should include the name of the voter. I hope this new feature is not too tricky to be implemented ... Thank you very much in advance for your help !

Regards,

Cécile Gorin

PS: Perhaps could you give me a workaround ? I know the way to insert votes directly into the database but I would prefer to avoid doing that...Thanks !
fields.summary: New Jelly Tag for Votes

fields.description:
We often upload patched jars to JIRA issues.  Often it is hard to tell which "version" of a jar is attached to the JIRA case.  JIRA should display the MD5 hash of the jar on the issue view, or on the "attachements listing" page.  This would be a big help when you

1. Want to confirm JIRA has the attachment you think you just uploaded
2. You have attached multiple versions, and everyone is getting confused.

The MD5 for each attachment should be in the audit log so I can see that there have been x different versions of this attachement.
fields.summary: Display MD5 Hashes for uploads

fields.description:
- First add a custom field, and make it of type Version Dropdown Searcher
- Create an issue, and select a version in the custom field 
- Check the email, it will contain text such as   "Scheduled release: 10001  (was: 10000)"

10000 is obviously an internal identifier, the actual release name is more like "TMAP-1.8.3"

Btw, it was selected as a Global custom attribute. And yes, we use about three version fields per issue.
fields.summary: Custom version fields incorrectly represented in emails

fields.description:
Minutes will be cut without a warning message, if you do not stick to the input format that is explained in the log work screen !!!

If the input value is '2h 30m'  the work log records 2 hours and 30 minutes.
If, however, the input vaue is '2h30m'  the work log records 2 hours only!

It is very important for our customer's project cost accounting that the figures for the "time spent" are accurate!
And it is unacceptable that an input value of the user is changed to another value without any error or warning 
message because of a wrong syntax!!

Please advise!
fields.summary: Log Work: input validation or error/ warning message required

It uses CustomFieldManager to retrieve a custom field of an issue.  Unfortunately we pass in a list of GenericValues instead of Issues, and CustomFieldManager wants Issues.

fields.description: The problem is that for time spent field in the issue navigator 24 per day and 7 days per week is used when showing the value.
fields.summary: Issue navigator shows wrong "Time Spent" when Work Log filled multiple times and longer then 1 week

fields.description:
At the moment if the priority is set to the default it will not be included in the summary of the issue if the priority is set to "major" (id 3).

The attempt is made to not include the priority in the notification if it has been set to the default value. At the moment the "default" is hardcoded to "3" (major priority).
As the default priority is configurable in JIRA we need to at least find out what it is when rendering notifictaions.

Potentially we should actually include the priority in the e-mail, even if it has been set to the default value. This is the subject for debate.

To get around the problem for now it is possible to edit the ./WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/text/includes/issuesummary.vm and remove the:
$issue.getString("priority") != "3"
check or replace it with the correct id for the default.

After modifying the velocity file the application server must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

Note that if user selected to receive HTML e-mail notifications, the priority is always shown.
fields.summary: The priority is excluded from the notifications if it is the default - the default is hard coded to id 3

fields.description: JIRA's mail queue is synchronous, which means that if a mail (or trackback ping) hangs, the whole queue is hung until JIRA is restarted (and the queued items lost).  Short of a proper fix (sending mails on a separate thread which can be timed out), we should give admins the ability to 'unstick' the queue, leaving the stuck thread to process its queue item and let the other mails through.
fields.summary: Allow stuck emails to be manually bypassed

fields.description:
Project Portlets can hide group of projects by its Category.
Apply the same hiding ability to each individual projects.
fields.summary: Allow Project portlets to hide like the category
CreateIssue Jelly tag does not convert field values

fields.description:
I've added a custom field (type Text Field < 255 characters), and it works fine, except I really would prefer it to shows as 2 rows instead of 1 on the form. I realize its description says "A basic single line text box custom field to allow simple text input." Assuming this would affect both my custom fields of this type, what file would I edit to accomplish this? I've been looking in WEB-INF\classes\templates\jira\issue\field, but I couldn't find an appropriate file there. I modified WEB-INF\classes\templates\plugins\fields\edit\edit-maxlengthtext.vm adding a new line 8: rows="2" cols="125" wrap="virtual", but that didn't help either. What file should be modified to expand this to 2 rows? Thanks. 

Maybe I should switch to  Free Text Field (unlimited text)? If I do, where do I control the rows for this one?
fields.summary: How do I increase rows for  Text Field (< 255 characters)

"Smart querying activated. Run search without smart query."

Its trying to display the little icon....

I will attach a screenshot
fields.summary: Sub-tasks' summary not displayed well in Excel

fields.description:
I am defining a complicated workflow with many statuses. The issues go through 2 main states: a) Request for Action, then b) Action. Both states involve many statuses, workflow steps and persons, and both can lead to closing the issue with several custom resolution.

I would like to be able to make a list of all open issues that are in state a) or of all that are open and in state b). I can't really use a filter like "status = a1 or a2 or a3 or a4 ..." because there are too many statuses in state a).

What I'd need is custom resolutions that work just like "unresolved" (ie issues with these resolutions appear in the lists of open issues ; subtasks with these resolutions appear in green, etc.). For now, setting the resolution of an issue to a custom one automatically closes it :-(
fields.summary: Custom resolutions working like "unresolved"

fields.description:
JIRA 3.3 now comes with Tomcat 5.5, and the switch seems to have broken logging quite badly:
 - Plain stdout / stderr logs are completely lost.
 - Editing the log levels in the admin section does not work properly. It looks like the log levels apply to Tomcat as a whole, not just to JIRA:
  - Increasing the root category level to DEBUG causes Tomcat internal logging to print (JspServlet, etc)
  -  If I increase the verbosity of a named package (eg. AccessLogFilter), the new logs appear in atlassian-jira.log, but not in catalina.out. Nothing appears there until I also increase the verbosity of the default (root) category.
fields.summary: JIRA Standalone logging broken
Update Italian translation

fields.description:
When bulk moving issues, if a field needMove but is not shown then an error message,
"This field cannot be updated and it is required to complete the move operation.", is shown. In reality this error will not stop the move operation from happening, it will instead blank-out the fields value. Perhaps the error should be more descriptive.
fields.summary: Error message on bulk move when field is not shown is misleading
Custom flag in JIRA administration as to whether the assignee field is a drop down or a user picker
New user preference to turn off all email notifications - for holidays etc.

fields.description:
To help manage large numbers of saved filters (personal or shared), we need to add categories to filter subscriptions. 

e.g. Using tabs under the saved filter portlet & manage filters screen, the categories could be personal/my, favourite and all.

* Personal - would be all the filters the user has created - with a checkbox next to all to mark them as favourites.
* All - would be a list / search function (depending on number of filters available) that would also include a check box next to each to mark it as a favourite. 
* Favourites - would be any filter marked as a favourite.
fields.summary: Add saved filter types / categories - personal, favourite and all saved filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7886].
  {panel}

Fixing one issue at different times can be very tricky. Almost every tracking system has problems with this level of detail, because you often want the single issue to remain a single issue (ie no cloning) but somehow to be fixed for different versions / branches at different times.

My suggestion to solve this effectively and simply is as follows:
- a custom field which can be applied to different projects where you want this ability
- an advanced searcher for the above field

The custom field would display checkboxes for each version in the fix versions field (ie derived data), with each checkbox indicating whether or not the issue had been fixed in that version. 

The searcher would then allow you to query 3 things:
- find issues which HAVE been fixed in versions x, y, z (ie have the checkbox checked and a fix version set for those versions)
- find issues which HAVEN'T been fixed in versions x, y, z but are scheduled (ie checkbox is not checked but fix version is set)
- find issues with ALL/ANY/NO unfixed versions (ie issues with all/any/no unchecked checkboxes)

Things to think about: how the custom field gets the values from the fix version field - most likely some sort of funky Javascript.
fields.summary: Fixes at different times across multiple versions / branches - best practice & custom field

fields.description:
Each version I have to find a different file to change to accomplish the customization of making the description column wider in the issue navigator. In 3.2 I changed the widths in styles/global_css.jsp (lines 799 and 806). This file doesn't exist in 3.3.1. Should I change global_static.css? If so, which lines?
I changed line 1156 from 30% to 70% but it didn't seem to have any effect. I see the font has been made smaller in version 3.3, which is OK. On your support site, it seems to show description wide enough, but not on my installation.
Thanks
fields.summary: Widen description column for issue navigator

fields.description:
I would like the ability to select multiple watchers at issue creation.

I realize I can do something similar with custom fields, but the user picker currently seems limited to a single user, not multiple users.
fields.summary: Ability to select watchers at issue creation

fields.description: When working on an issue its often helpful to have a printed version of the whole thing (and just that bug).  There doesn't seem to be a screen with this in mind - the default view issue screen has far too much navigation and layout stuff going on to get a decent print from a browser.  For perfect prints it might be handy to be able to save a particular bug as pdf and let acrobat deal with the printing rather than rely on the browsers
fields.summary: Printable view of current bug

fields.description:
It would be nice to have an attachment field in a transition view, and even be able to make it required or to write a validator that checks if an attachment has really been added.

(This is slightly different from, but comparable with, a custom field of type attachment.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7873].
  {panel}

From  CONF-3231:

 The mail error queue is currently useless.

* You have no indication what the error is
* All you can do is "resend all" or "delete all"

We need to work on the same principles as an MTA.

* If an error is permanent, give up and log the error somewhere.
* If an error is transient, put it on a queue to resend after a few hours.
* If a transient error keeps happening for a certain amount of time, give up and log the error somewhere.

Also useful would be:

* Keep track of users whose mail fails repeatedly, and stop sending them anything. Flag the account, and have a big note on their profile page saying "Notifications are currently disabled for this account due to repeated mail delivery failures. Please turn notifications back on on your notifications preferences page."
fields.summary: Improve the error mail queue

fields.description: I realize this is not fully supported, but consider if I have added the JIRA Suport Toolbar (the ability to edit/comment) to filters in the issue navigator. Now, when exporting current fields to Excel, it will also include that column, which is pretty useless since it will always just contain "Edit | Comment " with no links. Users will have to constantly delete that column, and I'm trying to make Excel output be as little work as possible for the user. Can you think of a way to have Excel output skip that column? I'd be willing to edit the .jsp file to accomplish this. Thanks.
fields.summary: Toolkit - support toolbar shouldn't be exported to Excel

fields.description:
As in issue JRA-6567, the new version of Excel current fields output produces output where Excel no longer has visible gridlines. I have been patiently waiting for version 3.3.1 to be released so I could train users on getting an Excel output, and now this problem has re-appeared. Can you please provide a patch (I'm used to customizing my jsp file now) to fix this?

This was working fine in version 3.3 and now appears to be broken in version 3.3.1 and the problem is reproducible on jira.atlassian.com. To see the problem, just export any filter to Excel. It is very hard to read without those gridlines.

I compared the navigator-excel-current.jsp files between 3.3 and 3.3.1 and the only difference was a valid one - for issue JRA-7598. So, I wonder if the problem is from another changed file?
fields.summary: Gridlines do not show up in "Current Fields" Excel view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7869].
  {panel}

it would be great if we could configure Jira to query Active Directory for distribution group membership when a email list is added to a Jira issue.

e.g. we often have the need to add an email mailing list address as a watcher to a Jira issue so that a logical group of staff are all kept up to date on an issue. the problem arises when an individual who is also a member of said mail list is listed individually as the reporter, the owner, or a watcher of an issue; in this case that person can receive multiple copies of the message. if Jira were to query AD to see that the reporter (e.g. user "x" with email addr "x@abc.com") is also a member of the email list (e.g. "abc@abc.com") which is specified as a watcher, then Jira could determine that it does not need to send mail to "x@abc.com" as the mail sent to "abc@abc.com" will already hit "x@abc.com".

of course this gets very complicated when multiple mail lists are involved or when lists have sub-lists.

as an alternative, if Jira sent email to all addresses as one message, rather than one message per address, then most MTAs and/or MUAs are smart enough to weed out duplicates.
fields.summary: Active Directory integration (distribution groups info from AD)

fields.description:
it would be great if we could configure Jira to treat all valid user accounts in an Active Directory OU as users with a specific set of configurations. e.g. all valid user accounts matching CN=*,OU=xyz,DC=company,DC=com are Jira users who belong to the Jira group "jira-users"

if/when exceptions are necessary they could be manually specified by adding local users whose configuration could override data pulled from AD.
fields.summary: Active Directory integration (all user info from AD)

fields.description:
it would be great if in the "Add User" dialogue we could tell Jira an Active Directory username, in either "domain\username", "username@domain", or "username" format, and have Jira query AD for the user's common name and email address as needed.

NOTE: I'm not requesting that Jira query AD once and store the auxiliary information but rather that Jira query AD each time the data is needed, this way if the data changes Jira stays dynamic.
fields.summary: Active Directory integration (more user info from AD)
ability to specify a "reporter" by email address or full name
ability to specify non-user watcher

fields.description:
I upgraded to 3.3 Ent. and started to add projects and custom fields. At first they seemed to show up fine, but then they disappeared. I just now noticed that in my orignal project that I had using 3.2 Pro the 2 custom fields that were in there aren't showing up either anymore. I checked the config over and over again and I cannot find a problem.

I am not sure how to send you the config so you can see it. Screenshots?
fields.summary: Custom Fields not showing up anymore
Record subjects of e-mail that create an issue

fields.description:
In our workflow we have added an extra postfunction to the 'Create Issue' transition. In this function we set the 'Assign To' issue field to a specific user. This is done to have all Feature Requests processed separately. This used to work fine in 3.0.3, but in 3.3 JIRA is checking if the user that created the Feature Request does have the assign issues permission (according to this stacktrace):

Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.workflow.WorkflowException: Error occured while creating issue.
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.SimpleWorkflowManager.createIssue(SimpleWorkflowManager.java:174)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultIssueManager.createIssue(DefaultIssueManager.java:303)
        ... 60 more
Caused by: com.opensymphony.workflow.WorkflowException: Unable to execute post workflow function. Issue may be in an inconsistent state. Please inform your system administrators immediately. Validation of the field 'assignee' failed: [You do not have permission to assign issues.] {}
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction.processField(UpdateIssueFieldFunction.java:185)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.UpdateIssueFieldFunction.execute(UpdateIssueFieldFunction.java:110)
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:1179)
        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.transitionWorkflow(AbstractWorkflow.java:1434)


It seems to me that performing a postfucntion in a workflow transition is something the JIRA system is doing and not the user that is creating the issue. For obvious reasons we don't want to give everyone the assign issues permission.

(I noticed some problems with other fields as well. It looks like setting the value for the Priority is broken as well, maybe due to permission issues too.)
fields.summary: 'Assign To' issue field cannot be set in workflow postfunction
Permissions on SOAP need to be revised to ensure that they are correct

fields.description:
Moving projects between categories will disable custom fields for that project

If you have a custom field A for project A and then you move the project to a new category, the custom field will no longer display (after a restart). You can work around this by reedting and saving the custom field configuration for the custom field after the project has been moved.
fields.summary: Moving projects between categories will disable custom fields for that project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7846].
  {panel}

This is a feature entry to guage the interest in Atlassian providing an enterprise level auditer.

An enterprise level auditer would be distinguishable from currently available logging services for the following reasons:

* Logging information is accessible via the Administration UI.
* Logging info. can be persisted in a database table if needed.
* Logging priorities are configurable on a component by component basis - i.e. an admin. could choose to audit security at a detailed level but only receive general notices about content creation. This configuration would occur in the Administration UI.

Another possible point to consider is logging across a cluster. If it ever appears the auditer might be leveraged to let admin.s administer federated logging.

*NOTE* - the clustering comment applies to current thinking for Confluence, not JIRA.

Furthermore, it would be nice if the auditer could work across both Confluence and JIRA - both product customers probably have a need for this level of logging. I'm creating this issue under Confluence for the timebeing but it is a relevant consideration for JIRA also.
fields.summary: Enterprise level auditing

fields.description: with 2005-09-01 translate files.

fields.description: The SOAP addComment(token, issueKey, RemoteComment) method doesn't add a comment to the specified issue.
fields.summary: addComment not adding a comment to the specified issue

fields.description:
For some reason, the JIRA SOAP interface requires all properties to be set on an elemement (such as an Issue or Comment) even though they are not used.

All can be worked around by setting zero length strings or zero length arrays as needed except Due Date which requires a Calandar instance.

Unused properties that are not *required* to create a new issue should be nullable.
fields.summary: SOAP interface requires all fields
Reindex in background to avoid locking users out

fields.description:
Hi!

It should be possible to correct logged work.  This is currently impossible, which makes it quite difficult to use time logging in JIRA to track how much time is spent correcting an issue.

Kind regards,

Tore Aamo Børresen
fields.summary: Possility to correct logged work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7837].
  {panel}

Hi!

It would be very nice to be able to get time reports within a selected time period.  I would like to be able to select a from date and a to date and get all issues within a project which as been worked on in that time period and how much time has been used within the selected dates.  Is that something that is doable?

Kind regards,

Tore Aamo Børresen
fields.summary: Time reports within a timeperiod

fields.description:
My project uses a custom issue type for main issues and a custom subtask type. Both have a specific issue type screen scheme and a workflow associated. When I create a subtask, the specific workflow is used (as attested by the statuses and workflow actions), but all transition views are empty! (No custom fields shown, only the possibility to comment.) The same happens at the creation of the subtask, no custom fields are shown.

Should I somewhere turn on the permission / possibility to edit the custom fields of the subtasks, or is there a bug?
fields.summary: Custom fields not shown in Create Screen and workflow transition views for Subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7835].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 5 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to work on this in the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original Request*

Often an issue represents a high-level view of an issue, and subtasks are low-level implementation details. Consequently the sub-tasks are not of much interest on the project reports (changelog, roadmap, Release Notes).  We should provide a checkbox to remove them.
fields.summary: Option to remove sub-tasks from roadmap / changelog / Release Notes

fields.description: Upgrade the Traditional Chinese package.  Thanks again to YB Chen.
fields.summary: Update Chinese translation package

fields.description: The problem is that issuesummary-rowcontents.vm does a $textutils.plainTextToHtml around teh summry instead of $textutils.htmlEncode
fields.summary: Portlets do not link issue summary properly if the summary contains links

fields.description:
Clciking on the XML view produces the XML view, though this is not in the same order as all other views.

This can be fixed by adding the following on to the URL:

&sorter/field=<field>&sorter/order=<order>

Where <field> should be the name of a field.  E.g, priority
and
<order> is eithe ASC or DESC
fields.summary: XML view is not sorted like all other views

fields.description:
When you change the Workflow, all issues have the Updated date changed to the current time.  This makes the field obsolete for searches as all issues within that Workflow will have the same updated date.

Though this is internally correct as when ever we create a change log, we should refresh the updated date.

Maybe provide option/switch/property that gives the administrator control over whether it is updated during workflow change.
fields.summary: Changing Workflow should not change Date Updated or provide option not to

fields.description:
In the multi-user picker (eg. when adding watchers), if you:
 - Filter by a group with lots of users
 - Check the box for a user
 - Click 'Next'
 - Check another user
 - Submit

Then only the second checked user is added.
fields.summary: Multi user picker loses checked users when Prev / Next clicked

the page shows:

-

<name>faultString</name>
<value>java.lang.NullPointerException</value>
</member>
-
	<member>
<name>faultCode</name>
-
	<value>
<int>0</int>
</value>
</member>
</struct>
</value>
</fault>
</methodResponse>

Is it possible to make it display a more user-friendly error page?

Also can this be subverted to get valid date without a proper login?
fields.summary: Going directly to /rpc/xmlrpc show non user-friendly error messages
Show names of projects instead of just "Project" in dashboard config

fields.description:
In the browse project view, you can see progress bars showing how many issues are assigned to each individual. Clicking on the link for each person launches a filter of (open) issues for that person sorted by priority. Makes sense. Except why would one sort by priority if you're not going to put the highest priority issues at the top of the list? I admit it's hard to interpret whether Priority Ascending means highest priority at the top or lowest, but I think you'd agree this was not your intent.
Is this an unintended side effect of JRA-6577?
Any chance of fixing this for 3.3.1 (pretty please?)
fields.summary: Preset Assigned to filter sorting incorrectly

fields.description: It would be nice to allow reporter to enter multiple users in cc custom field.  You can copy User Picker form from "Manage Watch List" screen.
fields.summary: Multiuser custom field - ability to select multiple users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7824].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. There are several add-ons that support this mentioned in the comments below. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer ([dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com])
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Add the ability to create a linked issue.

This would be functionailty similar to 'Create a Sub-task' but for any arbitrary link type, for example 'Duplicate'.

For example when viewing issue A, you could click 'create linked issue' and it would send you to the create form - with an additional select box for the link type. The form could be prefilled with data from the original issue (ie project, component, versions etc).
fields.summary: Create a Linked Issue operation

fields.description: At the moment the only options available are Any and the options. None would be a useful option to search by.
fields.summary: Select List Custom Field should have 'None' available to search by
"All" tab fails on VIew Issue screen if using subversion or perforce plugin and the issue has no subversion or perforce commits

fields.description:
If the following CSV is fed to the CSV import wizard:

id, Type, Summary (foo
100, Bug, Random Summary

Then after the first page where the columns are mapped to types, JIRA resets to first importer page.

Removing the '(' in the summary, or adding a matching ')' fixes this.
fields.summary: Unmatched bracket in CSV column names causes CSV import wizard to reset to start page
